thread.title: Croatia to allow free passage of migrants
thread.title_full: Croatia to allow free passage of migrants | Business Spectator

author: AFP
title: Croatia to allow free passage of migrants
text:
Croatia will allow free passage of migrants across its territory, Prime Minister Zoran Milanovic says as a first group entered the EU member state from Serbia since Hungary sealed its borders.
"They will be able to cross Croatia and we have been working intensively on that," Milanovic told MPs during a regular parliament session on Wednesday.
"We will above all have [the] interests and security of Croatia on our minds, but we will not forget that we're humans, Christians before all," he continued.
Milanovic said about 150 migrants reached Croatia on Wednesday and that "a small number" may be transported across the country.
"We're ready and, if you want, to channel those people ... it doesn't matter which colour or faith they are. Those people are here, they are women, children and men who want to live and create, but they don't want to be in Croatia.
"We are ready to accept and direct those people - their religion and skin colour is completely irrelevant - to where they apparently wish to go ... Germany, Scandinavia."
